title: The Lincoln Project
deleted: On October 29, 2021, a group of five people carrying [[Tiki torch|tiki-torches]] and dressed "like white supremacists" who [[Unite the Right rally|marched in Charlottesville]] in 2017, were seen posing in front of [[Virginia]] [[Republican]] gubernatorial nominee [[Glenn Youngkin]]'s campaign bus.<ref name=VICEstunt>{{cite news |last1=Joseph |first1=Cameron |title=Lincoln Project Posed as Charlottesville White Supremacists at GOP Event |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/3abzaj/lincoln-project-posed-as-charlottesville-white-supremacists-at-youngkin-gop-event |access-date=29 October 2021 |work=VICE |language=en}}</ref> The Youngkin campaign called it a publicity stunt, and a spokesperson for his election rival, [[Democrat]] [[Terry McAuliffe]], denied their involvement.<ref>{{cite news |title=Terry McAuliffe: Tiki-Torch Nazis Posed in Front of Youngkin Bus Not Affiliated With His Campaign |url=https://www.mediaite.com/news/terry-mcauliffe-denies-tiki-torch-nazis-that-posed-in-front-of-youngkin-bus-are-affiliated-with-his-campaign/ |work=Mediaite |date=29 October 2021 |language=en}}</ref> The Lincoln Project would later acknowledge they were behind the stunt, calling it "a demonstration",<ref>{{cite web |title=The Lincoln Project: Statement from the Lincoln Project |url=https://lincolnproject.us/statement-from-the-lincoln-project-5/ |website=The Lincoln Project |access-date=29 October 2021 |date=29 October 2021}}</ref><ref name=APstunt>{{cite news |title=Anti-Trump group takes credit for Virginia tiki torch stunt |url=https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-campaigns-race-and-ethnicity-racial-injustice-virginia-91e78d30da9cf79e7e7743273fc56026 |access-date=29 October 2021 |work=AP NEWS |date=29 October 2021 |language=en}}</ref> after ''[[VICE News]]'' identified one of the people in the photo as a Democratic operative, a colleague of journalist [[Lauren Windsor]],<ref name=VICEstunt></ref> who would later also admit her role.<ref>{{cite web |title=https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1jMJgeVbNlmKL |url=https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1jMJgeVbNlmKL |website=Twitter |access-date=29 October 2021 |language=en}}</ref><ref name=VICEstunt></ref> A spokesperson for Democratic nominee McAuliffe called the hoax "disgusting and distasteful, and we condemn it in the strongest terms", adding that "Those involved should immediately apologize.”<ref name=VICEstunt></ref><ref name=APstunt></ref> Democratic delegate [[Sally L. Hudson]] tweeted that "Charlottesville is not a prop. Our community is still reeling from years of trauma — especially this week. Don’t come back, @ProjectLincoln. Your stunts aren’t welcome here"<ref>{{cite news |title=Anti-Trump group takes credit for Virginia tiki torch stunt |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/anti-trump-group-takes-credit-for-virginia-tiki-torch-stunt/2021/10/29/1a25c968-390d-11ec-9662-399cfa75efee_story.html |access-date=29 October 2021 |work=Washington Post}}</ref>
